Description: A chemical company with a plant in Kansas City, Kan., pleaded guilty and was sentenced Thursday to pay a $1.5 million fine for violating a federal law regulating the storage of hazardous waste.
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/usao-ks/pr/chemical-company-kansas-city-kanordered-pay-15-million-finefor-mishandling-hazardous

Description: The U.S. Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced that Harcros Chemicals Inc.  entered into a proposed agreement to settle claims that Harcros violated provisions of the Clean Air Act aimed at preventing accidental releases of chemicals that can have serious consequences for public health, safety and the environment.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/reference-news-release-justice-department-and-epa-enter-settlement-harcros-chemicals

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/harcros-chemicals-inc-kansas-city-kansas-pay-civil-penalty-and-pay-project-reduce

https://www.justice.gov/usao-ks/pr/two-kansas-companies-fined-1-million-each-atchison-chlorine-gas-case
